common_errors.solution: Use -r <public_key> or -p for passphrase encryption: age -r age1xyz... file.txt > file.txt.age

common_errors.cause: Trying to decrypt a file that isn't encrypted with age, or file is corrupted
common_errors.solution: Verify the file was encrypted with age. Check file integrity.

common_errors.error_pattern: no identity matched any of the recipients
common_errors.cause: The identity (private key) used for decryption doesn't match any recipient the file was encrypted for
common_errors.solution: Ensure you have the correct identity file. Check which public key was used for encryption.

common_errors.cause: Wrong passphrase provided for passphrase-encrypted file
common_errors.solution: Try again with the correct passphrase. There's no recovery for lost passphrases.

common_errors.cause: Invalid recipient format - not a valid age public key or SSH public key
common_errors.solution: Use valid age public key (age1...) or SSH public key. Generate key with: age-keygen

common_errors.cause: Identity file path doesn't exist or isn't readable
common_errors.solution: Verify identity file path. Check file permissions. Default location: ~/.config/age/keys.txt

common_errors.cause: Armored (ASCII) format is malformed or truncated
common_errors.solution: Check for truncation. Ensure the entire armored block was copied including BEGIN/END markers.

common_errors.cause: Using a recipient that requires a plugin (e.g., YubiKey) but plugin isn't installed
common_errors.solution: Install the required age plugin: age-plugin-yubikey for hardware keys

common_errors.cause: Identity file exists but is empty or contains only comments
Using an SSH key type that age doesn't support (e.g., DSA)
common_errors.solution: age supports Ed25519 and RSA SSH keys. Generate compatible key: ssh-keygen -t ed25519
